intro: Crucianella tournefortii, commonly known as the Mediterranean sand verbena, is a small, flowering plant native to southern Europe and northern Africa. It typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions. Crucianella tournefortii is a hardy species that is well adapted to coastal and maritime climates.
